verses.verse: He who dwells <WH3427> in the secret <WH5643> place of the Most High <WH5945> will rest <WH3885> in the shadow <WH6738> of the Almighty. <WH7706>
I will say <WH559> of Yahweh, <WH3068> "He is my refuge <WH4268> and my fortress; <WH4686> my God, <WH430> in whom I trust. <WH982>"
For he will deliver <WH5337> you from the snare <WH6341> of the fowler, <WH3353> and from the deadly <WH1942> pestilence. <WH1698>
He will cover <WH5526> you with his feathers. <WH84> Under his wings <WH3671> you will take refuge. <WH2620> His faithfulness <WH571> is your shield <WH6793> and rampart. <WH5507>
You shall not be afraid <WH3372> of the terror <WH6343> by night, <WH3915> nor of the arrow <WH2671> that flies <WH5774> by day; <WH3119>
nor of the pestilence <WH1698> that walks <WH1980> in darkness, <WH652> nor of the destruction <WH6986> that wastes <WH7736> at noonday. <WH6672>
A thousand may fall at your side, and ten thousand at your right hand; but it will not come near you.
You will only look with your eyes, and see the recompense of the wicked.
Because you have made Yahweh your refuge, and the Most High your dwelling place,
no evil shall happen to you, neither shall any plague come near your dwelling.
For he will put his angels in charge of you, to guard you in all your ways.
They will bear you up in their hands, so that you won't dash your foot against a stone.
You will tread on the lion and cobra. You will trample the young lion and the serpent underfoot.
"Because he has set his love on me, therefore I will deliver him. I will set him on high, because he has known my name.
He will call on me, and I will answer him. I will be with him in trouble. I will deliver him, and honor him.
I will satisfy him with long life, and show him my salvation."
